alert.note: Alert for Kane; Lake; McHenry (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 03 at 8:08PM CST until further notice by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Illinois... Fox River at Algonquin Lock & Dam tailwater affecting Kane, McHenry and Lake IL Counties. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Fox River from Johnsburg downstream to Red Gate Road in St. Charles, including the Algonquin Lock & Dam tailwater gauge. * WHEN...From late tonight until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Water overflows low-lying river banks along Grove Street in Valley View, along River Shore Drive in Cary, and along Riverview Drive and Holiday Drive in Holiday Hills. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CST Friday the stage was 9.1 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached based on the latest forecast information. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: These forecasts are based on observed precipitation as well as forecast precipitation 48 hours into the future. Changes to the rainfall forecast, or any additional rainfall after 48 hours, may cause changes to these river forecasts. A Flood Watch means water levels above flood stage are possible, but not yet certain, based upon the latest forecasts. Persons along rivers and streams in the watch area should monitor the latest forecasts and be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/Chicago and water.weather.gov The next statement is expected by Saturday afternoon.
